main.name: Connor Meth
main.description: I have experience with JavaScript, Ruby on Rails, React.js, and React Native. I've worked in all departments of a software development team, providing me unique insight and understanding of the SDLC
main.bio: My main passions have always been sports and entertainment. Whether it was playing team sports like lacrosse and hockey, or individual sports such as skiing and golf, I always craved the competitiveness and thrill of victory that sports provide. Whenever I wasn't being active, my time would mostly be spent watching movies and tv shows or playing video games. These days when I'm not coding I play less team sports and video games, while skiing, golf, and watching movies/tv have become my main hobbies. A life goal of mine is to ski every major mountain in North America and Europe.

resume.skillmessage: During the Flatiron bootcamp, I learned Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, React.js, and taught myself React Native. I'm currently learning GraphQL and plan on starting Python after that.

education.description: Attended the JavaScript/Ruby on Rails software engineering bootcamp at Flatiron School in NYC. It was truly one of the best decisions I've made in my life. I had always loved computers and technology but up until about 2017, software engineering seemed like a such a foreign concept to me that I never really considered it. Working as a Software QA Analyst prior to starting at Flatiron allowed me to dip my toes into programming by learning SQL and basic CSS/HTML. I dabbled with some introductory free courses (Python mainly), which was interesting but difficult for me to get through. That all changed once I attended Flatiron. From those lectures, labs, and working with my peers I gained a new approach to learning. Before I knew it, the 4 month bootcamp was completed and I was equipped with multiple languages and frameworks at my disposal, as well as the ability/know-how to learn new ones

Attended Qunnipiac University in Hamden, CT where I received my Bachelors degree in Marketing. I was a member and senior captain of the Division 1 Mens's Lacrosse team at Quinnpiac. During my senior season in 2016, we won the program's first conference championship and participated in it's first NCAA Tournament. Being a Division 1 athlete taught me a lot of valuable life lessons including time management, working efficiently in a team to achieve a common goal, as well as how to lead that team. Outside of athletics, my coursework taught me a lot about the business side of things. Although I realized shortly after completing college that Marketing was not the industry for me, it was an incredibly valuable experience with learnings that stick with me to this day.

work.title: QA Analyst
work.description: Primary QA resource for the complete redesign of a global oral care company’s e-commerce website

work.title: QA Analyst
work.description: Manually tested major new feature releases on all major browsers and operating systems

work.title: Customer Success Specialist
work.description: Before transitioning to a QA Analyst role, I was the point of contact for user inquiries regarding the platform and the company's events branch.

projects.title: Cinebinge
projects.category: Streaming Availability app that recommends Movies/Shows based on the user's subscriptions. Built with React Native and Rails. Also built the demo site to showcase the app's features.

projects.title: Odds Ticker
projects.category: (MVP only) A virtual “Stock Ticker” for sports enthusiasts. Displays pre-game betting odds, live scores, and fantasy sports statistics for multiple sports

projects.title: Hungry Hungry Jeff's
projects.category: A JavaScript/HTML game based on Hungry Hungry Hippos featuring my classmate Jeff alongside famous people named Jeff. One and Two player modes are live (4 Players was a stretch goal)
